auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: Add income, planned expenses and goals to manage your family budget. Simple and effective.

header.title: How it works and why it helps
header.description: The method «enter income → set goals → categorize expenses → use envelopes» turns money from an abstraction into a clear plan: you see how much comes in, where it goes, which goals are more important, and what limits each category has. This reduces anxiety, eliminates «leaks» and gives a sense of control.

section1.title: 1) Enter income → understand the real base
section1.why: without honest income accounting, any plans are «in the air».
section1.what: a fixed framework (monthly/annual) from which limits and goal deadlines are calculated.
section1.result: illusions of «seems like enough» disappear, real numbers appear.
section1.inAppItem1: Enter all sources (salary, freelance, cashback, interest, rent, etc.).
section1.inAppItem2: Mark regularity (month/quarter/year) so calculations are correct.

section2.title: 2) Enter goals → give money direction
section2.what: priorities (cushion, vacation, down payment), deadlines and the required amount.
section2.result: motivation and success criteria appear («on track / behind schedule»).
section2.inAppItem2: The system will compare goals with the remainder after expenses and suggest what's realistic.

section3.title: 3) Categorize expenses → find «black holes»
section3.why: «expenses in general» can't be cut; specific categories can.
section3.what: visibility of «where it flows», quick wins in several categories.
section3.result: find 2–3 areas for optimization without feeling deprived.
section3.inAppItem1: Use ready-made categories (food, transport, housing, communication, etc.) or add your own.
section3.inAppItem2: Enable auto-accounting of depreciation/taxes for rental income — expenses will be recalculated automatically.

section4.title: 4) Envelope method → turn plan into behavior
section4.why: an «envelope» (category limit) turns intention into action.
section4.how: each category is assigned a strict limit; you can't spend beyond it, but you can consciously redistribute between envelopes.
section4.result: the budget becomes a self-limiting system — no need to «calculate in your head» all the time.
section4.inAppItem2: Track the envelope balance and the overall monthly balance.
section4.inAppItem3: If you don't fit — review the limit or goal priorities (the plan becomes more realistic).

whyItHelps.title: Why it really helps
whyItHelps.item1: From abstractions to structure: income → goals → categories → limits. The brain loves clear steps.
whyItHelps.item2: Priorities are visible: money «works» for goals, not «disappears» randomly.
whyItHelps.item3: Less stress: decisions are made during planning, not at the checkout.
whyItHelps.item4: Flexibility without self-deception: limits can be changed, but consciously — the trade-off is visible.
whyItHelps.item5: Feedback: progress and lag are visible immediately; the app suggests adjustments.

whatAppDoes.title: What the app does for you
whatAppDoes.item1: Converts currencies and provides a unified picture.
whatAppDoes.item2: Automatically allocates part of income to expenses (taxes, depreciation for rent).
whatAppDoes.item4: Warns about overspending and suggests options (shift limit, reduce spending, postpone goal).
whatAppDoes.item5: Saves scenarios (e.g., different city/suburb) and allows comparing them side by side.

howToUse.title: How to use it to make it work
howToUse.item1: Record all income (monthly + annual, bonuses, seasonal).
howToUse.item2: Add 2–3 main goals with amount and deadline.
howToUse.item3: Break down expenses by category and set envelope limits.
howToUse.item4: Live within limits: if there's not enough — change the limit or goal, don't ignore the plan.
howToUse.item5: Review once a month: the plan works when it's alive.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: Create a «base» scenario (minimum income) and an «optimistic» one. The app will show how to account for both.
faq.a2: Recalculate the deadline or reduce the amount. A realistic plan is better than a perfect one on paper.
faq.q3: Can I spend beyond the envelope?
faq.a3: Yes, but only through explicit redistribution from another envelope — this shows the compromise and reduces impulsive spending.
